page.title: 06BOW VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The present hall which is the centre of village social activities, was opened in 1983. It replaces a Y.M.C.A. hut which had been used since the Great War. Building began in 1979 using part time voluntary labour from the village.Money for materials was raised within the village by various fund raising activities held over a number of years.Besides the main hall,complete with large stage there is a small community room,billiard room,athletics room,cub scout room and storage rooms. The surfacing of the car park should be completed by the end of 1985.During the day the hall is used by the Playgroup and the Over Sixties Group.In the winter, Bow C.P.School use it for PE,Gymnastics and Badminton.It is in constant use for meetings,dances,entertainments and other special occasions.
